body: Currently, the plug-in is considered active if the parameter "sonar.bitbucket.accountName" is set. If not, it won't run. Are you suggesting a parameter like "sonar.bitbucket.enabled" here so that you don't need to remove the other parameters and can easily enable/disable the plug-in?

If it only active with the parameter "sonar.bitbucket.accountName", then it's ok for me.

I have the following problem. I execute the sonarqube analyze with the sonarqube plugin (http://docs.sonarqube.org/display/SONAR/Analyzing+with+Gradle) under gradle 2.8. I have nothing configured for the bitbucket plugin, but I get this exception after a successful sonarqube analysis.

```
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Either team-based API or an OAuth user authentication   has to be used
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.client.ClientAuthentication.configure(AuthenticationFilter.scala:70)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.client.BitbucketClient.createJerseyClient(BitbucketClient.scala:34)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.client.BitbucketClient.<init>(BitbucketClient.scala:26)
    at org.picocontainer.injectors.AbstractInjector.newInstance(AbstractInjector.java:145)
    at org.picocontainer.injectors.ConstructorInjector$1.run(ConstructorInjector.java:342)
```
I fixed that bug a week ago, but haven't released it yet. Could you please upgrade to the new version 1.0.1?
Thank you, it work's with the version 1.0.1. Now I can start testing it. :-)

Hi,

You have to specify a callback URL. You can set this to anything you want, it really doesn't matter as long as you have defined one. I'll update the documentation accordingly. 

Hope this helps.
this helped. thanks for the hint
To reproduce this issue, it would be great if you could show me the code. Is this a public Bitbucket repository?
this one not - I will create one and let you know. Thanks for looking into this
Thanks, looking forward to reproduce this issue.

Interestingly, there are only three issues reported when I run this code with the preview mode of SonarQube, and none of them is on a changed or new line:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/206944/11245248/fe1f5902-8e11-11e5-9278-b7e8890816b5.png)

So the plug-in is actually right :-) what do you think?

Ok - my fault it was. I hadn't had the plugin analysed on sonar and before and only made the preview analysis. To mark an issue as "new", it must have of course a basis to do so.

So after analysing master branch with sonar and then switch to a new branch with changes, I could analyse the project and the plugin reported the correct issues that were added....
Could not reproduce. Reason was that the wrong account name was chosen.
This issue seems related to SO post http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1798738/scala-parser-token-delimiter-problem

I have the same problem. 

[sonar4bitbucket] Failed to parse git diff: string matching regex `\z' expected but`
' found

my stack trace:

Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: [sonar4bitbucket] Failed to parse git diff: string matching regex `\z' expected but`
' found
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.diff.IssuesOnChangedLinesFilter.parseOrFail(IssuesOnChangedLinesFilter.scala:48)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.diff.IssuesOnChangedLinesFilter.filter(IssuesOnChangedLinesFilter.scala:19)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.review.ReviewCommentsCreator.processIssues(ReviewCommentsCreator.scala:76)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.review.ReviewCommentsCreator.createOrUpdateComments(ReviewCommentsCreator.scala:30)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.review.SonarReviewPostJob$$anonfun$executeOn$1.apply(SonarReviewPostJob.scala:21)
    at ch.mibex.bitbucket.sonar.review.SonarReviewPostJob$$anonfun$executeOn$1.apply(SonarReviewPostJob.scala:18)
    at scala.collection.immutable.List.foreach(List.scala:381)

In order to reproduce this issue, the diff for this pull request would be very helpful.

First, please execute this cURL statement:

curl -v -u YOUR_BITBUCKET_USER  https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/YOUR_USER_NAME/REPO_SLUG/pullrequests/PULL_REQUEST_ID/diff

then copy the URL from the Location Header field in the HTTP response (LOCATION_URL below) and use that with the appended “?context=0” parameter for the second cURL:

curl -u YOUR_BITBUCKET_USER  LOCATION_URL?context=0

The output of this second cURL statement would be the one of interest. Thanks in advance!

attached file with output of "diff"

[diff_response.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/81186/diff_response.txt)

Hi,
i think that i detect problem.

Problem is "\ No Newline at End of File" on git diff.

Each our pull request on bitbucket who have "\ No Newline at End of File" on diff doesn't work with your plugin. 

Maybe it will be helpful

Hi @mrueegg,

I've faced same problem when diff encounters "\ No newline at end of file". One such sanitized sample is attached for reference.

Rgds,
TJ
[diff.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/103139/diff.txt)

Hi @mrueegg 

thanks for reply.

This problem occurs quite often in our "pull request". 

i attached files with other examples.

[diff_wrong1.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/103143/diff_wrong1.txt)
[diff_wrong2.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/103144/diff_wrong2.txt)
[diff_wrong3.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/103145/diff_wrong3.txt)

Regards,
Luk
Thks @mrueegg for analysis. Pls feel free to use the previously attached sample for tests as this is sanitized already.
no problem, feel free to use my sample diff for test cases.
Please see version 1.0.7 which includes the bug fix for this issue.

Thank you Michael for your efforts. I already sent two diffs by email: one
passing and one falling.

Did you not receive the email or do you want more diffs?

Thanks,
Ganesh
On Jan 25, 2016 12:39 AM, "Michael Rüegg" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> Please excuse me for getting back to you that late!
> 
> @asdluki https://github.com/asdluki I wasn't able yet to reproduce this
> issue with your diff_response.txt file. In my tests, the parser is able to
> parse this file. It doesn't contain a "\ No Newline at End of File".
> Although I have a rule for the no newline case in the parser, it could be
> that it fails in certain scenarios. Is it often the case that the parser is
> not able to handle your pull requests? Could you please give me another
> example where the parser failed due to the no newline issue? That would be
> very helpful!
> 
> @wiseeker https://github.com/wiseeker Could you please provide me a
> diff as explained above for a pull request where the plug-in fails? That
> would be very helpful!
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/issues/8#issuecomment-174437302
> .

@wiseeker Excuse me, you are right, I found it. The problem with the FailingDiff.txt is that the context lines do not start with a single space, e.g. see <?xml and <Project:

```
+?
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+
<Project ToolsVersion="14.0" DefaultTargets="Build" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
```

According to the Git diff documentation, this should be the case. Do you have any idea why there is no space in front of context lines in this file?

Hi @mrueegg 

I found another case where issue is replicable - new file mode (a sample is attached). Plugin (v1.0.7) is reporting "java.lang.RuntimeException: [sonar4bitbucket] Failed to parse git diff: string matching regex `\z' expected but"
[diff_newFile.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/103684/diff_newFile.txt)
@tajain Unfortunately, I was not able to reproduce this issue with 1.0.7. Could you please provide me the full stack trace?

Hi,

I'm still having the same problem with version 1.0.7.

git diff: [diff_wrong4.txt](https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin/files/106391/diff_wrong4.txt)

In order to reproduce this issue, the diff for this pull request would be very helpful.

First, please execute this cURL statement:

curl -v -u YOUR_BITBUCKET_USER https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/YOUR_USER_NAME/REPO_SLUG/pullrequests/PULL_REQUEST_ID/diff

then copy the URL from the Location Header field in the HTTP response (LOCATION_URL below) and use that with the appended “?context=0” parameter for the second cURL:

curl -u YOUR_BITBUCKET_USER LOCATION_URL?context=0

The output of this second cURL statement would be the one of interest. Thanks in advance!
